org.simplity.kernel.comp

Class GroupManager<T extends Component>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.simplity.kernel.comp.GroupManager<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - component being managed
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Loadable

    public class GroupManager<T extends Component>
extends Object
implements Loadable
    some components are organized into a collection that is saved in a file. (like message). This interface represents such a group that can add its individual components into collection.
    Author:
    simplity.org

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GroupManager(Class<?> componentClass)
      instantiate a group manager for a Component type

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Object getObjectToLoad(String tagName)
      If an object that is loaded from an xml has a field that is a collection of objects, specifically an array of objects, or Map of objects, then the xml loader uses tag as the name of class.(with first character UPPed).
      void moveComponents(Map<String,T> collection)
      add components from this group into the collection.

      • getObjectToLoad

        public Object getObjectToLoad(String tagName)
                       throws XmlParseException
        Description copied from interface: Loadable
        If an object that is loaded from an xml has a field that is a collection of objects, specifically an array of objects, or Map of objects, then the xml loader uses tag as the name of class.(with first character UPPed). By default it assumes that theses classes are in the same package as the parent object. If this is not true, this method should return an instance of the object to be used to load the element
        Specified by:
        getObjectToLoad in interface Loadable
        Parameters:
        tagName - Tagname
        Returns:
        object to be used to load this element
        Throws:
        XmlParseException - in case of any error in loading
